text: Rabbi Yehuda Herzl Henkin (1945 – December 24, 2020) was an Israeli rabbi and modern orthodox posek. He was born in Jerusalem. Henkin was the founder and head of Nishmat, the Institute for Advanced Jewish Studies for Women.Nishmat.net Henkin died in Jerusalem on December 24, 2020 at the age of 75.Rabbi Yehuda Herzl Henkin, pioneer of women’s leadership in Orthodoxy, dies ==References== Category:1945 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Rabbis from Jerusalem
title: Yehuda Henkin
